title: Electronic licence to report pig movements

details.description: Pig movement licence for pig keepers - BPEX electronic licence, AML2 electronic replacement eAML2
details.more_information:
The eAML2 combines the original paper form AML2 and the Food Chain Information forms.

Copies of the AML2 are automatically uploaded to Trading Standards so you no longer need to post them.

You will need: 

* your membership number if you're in an assurance scheme
* the herdmark, holding number and site postcode if you're not in an assurance scheme


##Cross compliance
These standards are part of [cross compliance.](http://rpa.defra.gov.uk/rpa/index.nsf/UIMenu/814240C66F10CAC8802570C7004248D4?Opendocument "Cross compliance (Rural Payments Agency)"){:rel="external"} You must meet them to get your farming subsidy under the [Single Payment Scheme](/single-payment-scheme-online "Manage your Single Payment Scheme online").
details.introduction: Apply online with the British Pig Executive (BPEX) for an electronic licence for pig movements (eAML2).
details.alternate_methods:
You can report pig movements by phone and get advice by email. 
 
$C 
**eAML2 helpline**  
<eaml2@bpex.org.uk>  
**Telephone:** 0844 335 8400  
Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm   
Calls cost 5p per minute from landlines
$C

Some organisations act as agent's and can report pig movements for you. Contact the eAML2 helpline for more information.
